languages.text: {n}Первая ложка дается с трудом, но {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}новобранцем{/d} вы ели стряпню и похуже. Распробовав солоноватый вкус и вязкую текстуру варева, вы приканчиваете похлебку и под изумленными взглядами облизываете ложку. В окопе подобную еду назвали бы... сносной.{/n}

{n}The first spoonful hits you hard, but you ate worse as a {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}rookie in the Guard{/d}. Once you get accustomed to the salty taste and gloppy texture of the soup, the crowd watches in awe as you finish the whole bowl and lick the spoon at the end. Out there in the trenches, they call food like this "tolerable."{/n}
languages.original_text: {n}Первая ложка дается с трудом, но {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}новобранцем{/d} вы ели стряпню и похуже. traits.locale_text: {n}The first spoonful hits you hard, but you have eaten worse as a {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}rookie in the Guard{/d}. Once you get accustomed to the salty taste and the gloppy texture of the soup, the crowd watches in awe as you finish the whole bowl and lick the spoon at the end. Out there in the trenches, they call food like this 'tolerable.'{/n}

languages.text: {n}Der erste Löffel kostet dich Überwindung, aber du hast als {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}Rekrut in der Wache{/d} schon Schlimmeres gegessen. Als du dich an den salzigen Geschmack und die schleimige Konsistenz der Suppe gewöhnt hast, verfolgen die Umstehenden ehrfürchtig, wie du die gesamte Schüssel auslöffelst und am Ende den Löffel ableckst. Draußen in den Schützengräben bezeichnet man eine solche Mahlzeit als 'tolerabel'.{/n}
languages.original_text: {n}The first spoonful hits you hard, but you ate worse as a {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}rookie in the Guard{/d}. traits.locale_text: {n}Der erste Löffel kostet dich Überwindung, aber du hast als {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}Rekrut in der Wache{/d} schon Schlimmeres gegessen. Als du dich an den salzigen Geschmack und die schleimige Konsistenz der Suppe gewöhnt hast, verfolgen die Umstehenden ehrfürchtig, wie du die gesamte Schüssel auslöffelst und am Ende den Löffel ableckst. Draußen in den Schützengräben bezeichnet man eine solche Mahlzeit als 'tolerabel'.{/n}

languages.text: {n}La première cuillerée vous prend à la gorge, mais vous avez mangé pire lorsque vous étiez {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}{mf|un bleu|une bleue} au sein de la garde{/d}. Une fois {mf|habitué|habituée} au goût salé et à la texture gluante de la soupe, vous stupéfiez la foule en finissant le bol avant de lécher la cuillère. Dans les tranchées, une telle nourriture était considérée comme « tolérable ».{/n}
languages.original_text: {n}The first spoonful hits you hard, but you ate worse as a {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}rookie in the Guard{/d}. Once you get accustomed to the salty taste and gloppy texture of the soup, the crowd watches in awe as you finish the whole bowl and lick the spoon at the end. Out there in the trenches, they call food like this "tolerable."{/n}

traits.locale_text: {n}La première cuillerée vous prend à la gorge, mais vous avez mangé pire lorsque vous étiez {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}{mf|un bleu|une bleue} au sein de la garde{/d}. Une fois {mf|habitué|habituée} au goût salé et à la texture gluante de la soupe, vous stupéfiez la foule en finissant le bol avant de lécher la cuillère. Dans les tranchées, une telle nourriture était considérée comme « tolérable ».{/n}

languages.text: {n}La primera cucharada entra con dificultad, pero probaste cosas peores siendo {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}recluta de la Guardia{/d}. Una vez que te acostumbras al sabor salado y a la textura grumosa del caldo, la multitud contempla estupefacta cómo apuras el cuenco entero y hasta lames la cuchara al acabar. En las trincheras considerarían que este tipo de comida es «tolerable».{/n}
languages.original_text: {n}The first spoonful hits you hard, but you ate worse as a {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}rookie in the Guard{/d}. Once you get accustomed to the salty taste and gloppy texture of the soup, the crowd watches in awe as you finish the whole bowl and lick the spoon at the end. Out there in the trenches, they call food like this "tolerable."{/n}

Una vez que te acostumbras al sabor salado y a la textura grumosa del caldo, la multitud contempla estupefacta cómo apuras el cuenco entero y hasta lames la cuchara al acabar. En las trincheras considerarían que este tipo de comida es «tolerable».{/n}

languages.text: {n}最初の一匙は強烈に感じたが、{d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}護衛の新人時代{/d}は、もっと酷いものを食べていたはずだ。スープの塩辛い味とねっとりとした食感に慣れてくると、観衆はあなたがボウルの中身をすべて食べ終え、最後にスプーンまで舐めるのを、畏敬の念を持って見守っている。塹壕の外では、このような食べ物を「許容範囲」という。{/n}
languages.original_text: {n}The first spoonful hits you hard, but you ate worse as a {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}rookie in the Guard{/d}. Once you get accustomed to the salty taste and gloppy texture of the soup, the crowd watches in awe as you finish the whole bowl and lick the spoon at the end. Out there in the trenches, they call food like this "tolerable."{/n}

traits.locale_text: {n}最初の一匙は強烈に感じたが、{d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}護衛の新人時代{/d}は、もっと酷いものを食べていたはずだ。スープの塩辛い味とねっとりとした食感に慣れてくると、観衆はあなたがボウルの中身をすべて食べ終え、最後にスプーンまで舐めるのを、畏敬の念を持って見守っている。塹壕の外では、このような食べ物を「許容範囲」という。{/n}

languages.text: {n}尽管第一勺让你头晕目眩，但你在{d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}帝国卫队当新兵的时候{/d}，吃过比这还难吃的东西。当你习惯了汤的咸味和黏糊糊的口感之后，就毫不费力地喝光了一整碗汤，还把勺子都舔干净了，这赢得了在场所有人敬畏的目光。在战壕里，这样的食物被称为“能受得了的东西。”{/n}
languages.original_text: {n}The first spoonful hits you hard, but you ate worse as a {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}rookie in the Guard{/d}. Once you get accustomed to the salty taste and gloppy texture of the soup, the crowd watches in awe as you finish the whole bowl and lick the spoon at the end. Out there in the trenches, they call food like this "tolerable."{/n}

traits.locale_text: {n}尽管第一勺让你头晕目眩，但你在{d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}帝国卫队当新兵的时候{/d}，吃过比这还难吃的东西。当你习惯了汤的咸味和黏糊糊的口感之后，就毫不费力地喝光了一整碗汤，还把勺子都舔干净了，这赢得了在场所有人敬畏的目光。在战壕里，这样的食物被称为“能受得了的东西。”{/n}

languages.text: {n}Ağzına kadar dolu ilk kaşık sana ağır gelse de {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}çaylak bir Muhafız{/d} olduğun dönemde daha kötüsünü yemiştin. Kalabalık, çorbanın tuzlu tadına ve yapışkan kıvamına alıştıktan sonra tüm kâseyi bitirip kaşığı yaladığın esnada seni hayranlıkla izliyor. Siperlerde böyle yiyeceklere "idare eder" derler.{/n}
languages.original_text: {n}The first spoonful hits you hard, but you ate worse as a {d|Encyclopedia:CharGen_Militarum}rookie in the Guard{/d}. Once you get accustomed to the salty taste and gloppy texture of the soup, the crowd watches in awe as you finish the whole bowl and lick the spoon at the end. Out there in the trenches, they call food like this "tolerable."{/n}
